title: Vikings' Ragga Ragnars gets fans hyped for final with BTS throwback
text:
Vikings star Ragga Ragnars gets fans hyped for final (Pictures: Instagram/History)

Vikings season six is just months away, and the cast are starting to get fans hyped for the final installment of the History Channel hit.

Not that we needed help getting there, but actress Ragga Ragnars decided to share a behind the scenes throwback, and now we’re too excited.

Taking to her Instagram story, the 35-year-old uploaded a picture of herself all done up as Bjorn’s wifey, Gunnhild.

Giving nothing away, she simply wrote her character’s name alongside the snap before tagging the show in the piece.

This isn’t the first time she has teased the upcoming episodes, as she recently dropped a picture of herself standing out at sea on a jetty, in full Nordic garb.

In the caption, the star wrote: ‘Gunny is ready.. are you?’

She shared a BTS throwback ahead of season 6 (Picture: Instagram/raggaragnars)

Fans of the show were sent into meltdown, as they commented: ‘I’m so f**king ready!’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Someone else wrote: ‘Hell yessss,’ while another added: ‘There she is. I am also ready and prepared for the next season…’

While not much is known about the character’s story arc, the latest trailer made it look as though there’s tension between Gunnhild and her man Bjorn (Alexander Ludwig).

Ivar The Boneless is trying to take power of his lands once again with the help of the Rus army, and it looks as though the pressure is getting to his big brother.

So much so he’s starting to make mistakes – which could be threatening the safety of Kattegat.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

When finding some alone time with his girl, Gunny seems to be let down by her king, as she tells him: ‘You are a great man. But even great men make mistakes.’

And it looks as though there’s another great man on his way to Kattegat as Harald can be seen wearing a crown.

The warrior has been desperate to be crowned King of Norway ever since he entered the show back in season four.

While toying with the idea when talking to Hvitserk (Marco Ilsø) and Rollo (Clive Standen) it looks as though his dream has finally come true.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Although he has been recognised as York’s ruler, we’re yet to see him in a crown, and the new trailer shows the fierce warrior sporting some pretty shiny headwear.

Yes, there’s a new king in town, and despite coming to Bjorn’s side in the previous season, we can’t help but feel the son of Ragnar needs to be afraid.

Vikings season six will drop onto the History Channel and Amazon Prime 4 December.

description: Vikings star Ragga Ragnars gets fans hyped for final with BTS throwback ahead of season 6.
